channel.title: My First Java Application. - LSTE V1
channel.description:
[b]Project:[/b][i]LSTE (Lagex Simple Text Editor)[/i] [b]Description:[/b][i]Its a very simple text editor :) with a Moparisthebest- Like GUI :). it is my first app and im planning on learning how to add save,save as,new. :D[/i] [b]Author:[/b] Wonderguy6 - Me , www.lagex.net
http://lagexx.ulmb.com/TextEditorV2.jar http://www.megaupload.com/?d=BF4IK3WL

item.title: My First Java Application. - LSTE V1
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

To append text, using a particular color:

StyleContext sc = StyleContext.getDefaultStyleContext();
AttributeSet aset = sc.addAttribute(SimpleAttributeSet.EMPTY, StyleConstants.Foreground, color);
yourTextPane.setCharacterAttributes(aset, false);  
int len = yourTextPane.getText().getLength();
setCaretPosition(len); //This is hax really. If the carat position is important, save it here, and then later set it back.
replaceSelection(yourWord); //Well there isn't anything selected, so it just puts the text in?

Pretty much uglyhax, but I like it.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Java Application. - LSTE V1
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“regecks`, post:5, topic:59718”]How to skip the download timer on that lagex download site, put this into your browser:

javascript: void(count = 0);

As for the app, remember:

  • All class names start with capitals and are camel capped (i.e, MyJavaFile)
  • All field names and methods start with lowercase and are camel capped (i.e someField, myMethod)

No need to put so much whitespace in either =P.

I see you also apply the metalic L&F the hard way, there’s a shortcut in the JFrame class:

JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

You can execute the above method as long as its before any GUI component is initialized, so in your entry point or something.

So far so good though. Try adding some JMenu’s or some buttons that save and load your documents or something.[/quote]
Thanks so much.
If i could i would give the same as you gave me.

also.

Im buying a big book aswell (Mr.Chris wannabe ;))

so maybe that might help me.

Read full topic

item.source: My First Java Application. - LSTE V1

item.title: My First Java Application. - LSTE V1
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

How to skip the download timer on that lagex download site, put this into your browser:

javascript: void(count = 0);

As for the app, remember:

  • All class names start with capitals and are camel capped (i.e, MyJavaFile)
  • All field names and methods start with lowercase and are camel capped (i.e someField, myMethod)

No need to put so much whitespace in either =P.

I see you also apply the metalic L&F the hard way, there’s a shortcut in the JFrame class:

JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

You can execute the above method as long as its before any GUI component is initialized, so in your entry point or something.

So far so good though. Try adding some JMenu’s or some buttons that save and load your documents or something.

Read full topic

lawl - Where is super(“Frame Title”);?

Also, the GUI theme is Metal. There are others to choose from
